description.narrative:
New/additional funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 UNICEF has applied to Sida for funding of 15 million SEK to carry out the implementation of UNICEF's activities within the thematic area "Child Protection" in BiH as part of the UNICEF Strategic Plan 2018-2021 and as outlined in the UNICEF Country Programme Document 2015-2020 in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The objectives of the Programme are: -- By 2019, an increased number of boys and girls use a continuum of child protection services aimed at preventing and adequately responding to violence, neglect and abuse and family separation, and equitable access to justice is strengthened for all children. -- Strengthened children and their families’ capacity to demand child protection services -- Service providers better equipped to deliver child protection services -- Children at- risk, child victims and witnesses of crime, children as parties in civil and administrative proceedings and children in conflict with the law better served and protected

Nya medel/medeltillägg för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 UNICEF har ansökt hos Sida för 15 miljoner SEK i finansiering för att utföra implementeringen av UNICEF:s aktiviteter inom det tematiska området ”Child Protection” i BiH som en del av UNICEF:s strategiska plan 2018-2021 och som skissades i UNICEF Country Program Document 2015-2020 i Bosnien och Hercegovina.
Målen för programmet är: - Till 2019, ett ökat antal flickor och pojkar använder ett kontinuum av tjänster inom barnskydd riktade att förhindra och ge adekvat respons på våld, försummande, missförhållanden och familjeseparation, och att rättvis tillgång till rättvisa för alla barn stärks. - Stärka barnen och deras familjers kapacitet att kräva barnskyddstjänster. - Att service givare är bättre utrustad att leverera barnskyddstjänstera. - Att barn i riskzonen, barn som är offer och vittnen till brott, barn som är del av civilrättsliga och administrativa framfaranden och barn i konflikt med lagen är bättre omhändertagna och skyddade.

Support to UNICEF core/thematic programme in BIH has the overall objective (Outcome 2 of Country programme) that child protection systems are strengthened to prevent and respond to cases of violence, abuse, exploitation, and neglect of children, including institutionalization, and specifically to the following outputs and results: OUTPUT 1: Strengthened children and their families capacity to demand child protection services OUTPUT 2: Service providers better equipped to deliver child protection services OUTPUT 3. Children at risk, child victims and witnesses of crime, children as parties in civil and administrative proceedings and children in conflict with the law better served and protected End

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.

description.narrative: Key results of the Child Protection Programme include the following: •Development and adoption of specialized entity legislation(s) for protection of children in contact with the law •Juvenile offending decreased by 70% from 2009 to 2019 •The number of children in conflict with the law placed in institutions decreased between 52% (FBiH) and 60% (RS) from 2012 until 2021 •More than 63% of the municipalities created the conditions for implementation of diversion measures, while 2/3 of the prosecutors offices used the diversion in 2020 •The number of support providers employed and budgeted by the government increased almost 6 times, from 4 in 2014 to 22 in 2021 •Since 2016 the number of children provided with the specialized psychosocial support increased by more than 20% •Secondary prevention programme reaching more than 150,000 children in schools in BiH •Critical shift in the justice for children approaches from punitive and institutional to restorative and community-based •Assessment of the social service workforce (SSW) in child protection, to further enhance regulatory and institutional frameworks, planning, developing and supporting the SSW •In partnership with the Roma NGOs Romalen and Kali Sara, focus on addressing child marriage, violence, human trafficking, child labour and discrimination; case study on legal and procedural bottlenecks regarding access to preschool education (9 municipalities) •COVID response - enhanced the provision of community-based MHPSS, reaching directly some 14,000 children and 2,800 caregivers •Migration - ensured child protection to 3,500 children on the move (1,900 UAC). Distribution of winter clothes and shoes to some 1,000 children •UNICEF in partnership with IFS-EMMAUS raised awareness of children, caregivers and the general public about violence against children, including violence in the digital environment, and how to prevent and report violence. End
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
